# Acquisition and Delivery of a Laboratory Food, Plant Material and Resin Grinder

**Announcement**
Health Canada is soliciting proposals for the acquisition and delivery of a laboratory food, plant material and resin grinder. This request is reserved for holders of Supply Arrangement #E60PV-19EQUI.

**Background**
Suppliers who are currently pre-qualified on Supply Arrangement E60PV-19EQUI for Laboratory and Scientific Equipment, Parts and Accessories, Services and Supplies with Public Works and Government Services Canada have been invited to bid.

**Requirements**
Health Canada requires a laboratory food, plant material and resin grinder that meets the following criteria:

* The instrument must be able to be placed on a table with a maximum size of 75 cm (30 inches) long and 50 cm (20 inches) wide.
* The instrument must be able to homogenize plant, resin and food samples.
* The instrument must be designed for laboratory operation.
* The instrument must be able to accommodate at least 24 x 15 mL and 16 x 50 mL tubes.
* The instrument must have a speed range between 500 and 1750 strokes/minute.
* The instrument must allow for program design with run times, speed and number of cycles.
* The instrument must have a display showing remaining time and speed.

**Deliverables**
The supplier is required to deliver the instrument to Health Canada's Cannabis Laboratory,

1001 Laurent-Ouest, Longueuil, QC, Canada
Delivery is expected before March 24, 2023.

**Other Requirements**

* Suppliers must label all equipment and furnishings as being the property of Canada.
* Suppliers must provide a list of the name, manufacturer, model number, serial number, optional equipment, supplier and price for each item of equipment or furnishings purchased.

**Contact Information**
For more information, please contact:
Laferriere, Chantal
Email: chantal.laferriere@hc-sc.gc.ca
Phone: 613-410-5333

**Note**
This solicitation is limited to pre-qualified suppliers on Supply Arrangement E60PV-19EQUI. Suppliers who wish to be considered must be pre-qualified in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Supply Arrangement. Only suppliers who meet the requirements listed above will be considered for selection. No bidders who are not pre-qualified will be evaluated.
